result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas A. Busshardt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Proposed Stipulation and Order to amend Judgment of Conviction

Jefferson County DNA Proof of Submission
submitted by Attorney Witt in support of the defendant

[MK] case called at 11:22am. 
Defendant Nicholas A. Busshardt in court with Attorney Michael C. Witt.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Sentencing arguments given by counsel.   
Mr. Busshardt makes a statement.

On Counts #1, #2, #3, the Court withholds sentence, and places Mr. Busshardt on Probation for 3 years, with conditions:
--(on Count #1 only) to serve 45 days in the Jefferson County Jail, with work-release privileges for employment, childcare, counseling or other treatment;  to commence on 11/16/15 at 7:00pm.
---Mr. Busshardt is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without non-prescribed controlled substances in system; non-compliance will result in loss of work-release privileges without further process.
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment 
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, and counseling as required by the Agent
--contact with Natalie Busshardt and the minor children as permitted by Jefferson County Human Services Department
--no possession of any dangerous weapon
--not to commit any acts of violence or make any threats of violence toward any person
--to complete certified Batterers Intervention Programming
--no possession or consumption of alcohol
--no presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores
--to pay costs of $243 plus the $200 DNA surcharge plus $33 summons fee on Count #1
--to pay costs of $243 plus the $200 DNA surcharge plus the $100 Domestic Abuse Surcharge on Count #2
--to pay costs of $243 plus the $200 DNA surcharge on Count #3
--to comply with DNA sample provision

Days credit for time already served:  1 day
recess 11:50am.
Proposed Stipulation and Order for Continuance
With elements and criminal case settlement agreement forms attached.

Case called at 8:58 am [Clerk SH] (Case was scheduled for Motion Hearing)
Defendant Nicholas A. Busshardt in court with Attorney Michael C. Witt. ADA Theresa A Beck appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Beck submits AMENDED information & victim impact statement
Service of the AMENDED information admitted; reading waived; maximum penalties recited

Constitutional rights given; plea of "No Contest" entered on Count#1, plea of "Guilty" on Count #2, and plea of "No Contest" on Count#3; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.
On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count #4
Atty Witt requests sentencing in approximately 30 days, presents basis; No objection from State
Court reminds Mr. Busshardt that his bond/conditions of release remain in effect while case is pending
Recess: 9:16 am 

NEXT: (1) Schedule Sentencing Hearing 10/29/15 at 10:30 am (30 minutes) - Send notices
Letter from the state ref scheduling

Case called at 10:12am [mo]
Attorney Michael C. Witt in court.     ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant, Nicholas Busshardt does not appear, he was excused at previous hearing

Oral Ruling on Defense's Motion to Sever Charges:
--The Court reviews the Criminal Complaint and Preliminary Hearing transcript
--Arguments given by Counsel
--The Court denies the Defense's Motion to Sever Charges; gives basis and analysis

The Court may allow the admission of contextual history of the relationship into evidence for Trial; must be pertinent to these incidences
--The Defense is to submit its list of other acts evidence by 9/25/15 eob
--The State is to submit its list of other acts evidence by 9/25/15 eob
recess: 10:26am

NEXT: (1) Motion Hearing to be scheduled by the JA (atleast 1 week prior to Trial, allow 90 minutes) (2)FSSC on 10/13/2015 at 9:00am (3)Jury Trial on 10/19 and 10/20/2015 at 8:30am (allow 2 days)

Case called at 8:35am [mo]
Defendant Nicholas A. Busshardt in court with Attorney Michael C. Witt.   ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.


On Defendant's 7/13/15 Motion to Sever Charges:
--arguments in favor of motion given by Atty. Witt
--arguments against motion given by ADA Beck 

Atty. Witt requests the Court to review the Preliminary Hearing transcript
The Court defers the decision on this Motion until it has time to review the Preliminary Hearing transcript

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--pleas of "not guilty" entered

The Court reminds Mr. Busshardt that his bond and its conditions remain in effect.
recess :8:55am--reconvene:8:56am [The Court and Counsel discuss scheduling]
Atty. Witt requests that Mr. Busshardt to be excused from the next hearing since it has been scheduled in short time
--no objection from ADA Beck
The Court excuses Mr. Busshardt from the next hearing
recess: 9:00am

Case called at 2:01pm.  Clerk - CRHI.  
Defendant Nicholas A. Busshardt in court via video with Attorney Yelena Zarwell from the Jefferson County Public Defenders Office for bond purposes only.  Defendant Nicholas A. Busshardt in custody. Public Service Special Prosecutor Flint appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Upon agree of the parties, the Court fines the video connection to be sight and sound sufficient.

Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited
Right to counsel given; constructive waiver of counsel warnings given.
Preliminary Hearing time limits waived by both parties.

-- No presence at any residence of Natalie Busshardt or minor children B.N.B. or J.B. - except once in the presence of law enforcement to obtain personal belongings.
